main event: A sighting of a bright, triangular-shaped object reported over Dooly, GA on January 5, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 minutes and appeared to move intelligently, resembling an airplane engine sound., Radar scope photographs corroborated details of the eyewitness reports., The object's brilliance was similar to the moon, making it appear twice as bright., It was initially stationary before ascending slowly, then appearing to drift eastward., Both witnesses had pilot ratings and were considered reliable sources of information.
witness description: 1st Lt. Dean L. Beach and 4th Lt. John A. Gasseeine, both with pilot ratings
